intro: Conostylis canteriata, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia, specifically found on Kangaroo Island. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its erect, spindly stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its habitat. Conostylis canteriata is a perennial herb that produces distinctive, often blue or purple-colored flowers, which attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
